intro: Lopezia miniata subsp. miniata, commonly known as the small-flowered lotea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow to white flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, demonstrating adaptability to harsh conditions. The subspecies is distinguished by its compact growth habit and reduced floral structures compared to other Lopezia species.
